FeedItems.Title: Announcing SignalR for ASP.NET Core Alpha 2
FeedItems.Summary: A few weeks ago we released the alpha1 version of SignalR for ASP.NET Core 2.0. Today we are pleased to announce a release of the alpha2 version of SignalR for ASP.NET Core 2.0. This release contains a number of changes (including API changes) and improvements. Notable Changes The JSON hub protocol now uses camel casing... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Announcing SignalR (alpha) for ASP.NET Core 2.0
FeedItems.Summary: Today we are glad to announce an alpha release of SignalR for ASP.NET Core 2.0. This is the first official preview release of a new SignalR that is compatible with ASP.NET Core. It consists of a server component, a .NET client targeting .NET Standard 2.0 and a JavaScript/TypeScript client. What’s New? SignalR for ASP.NET Core... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Welcome to the New Blog Template for ASP.NET Developers
FeedItems.Summary: By Juliet Daniel, Lucas Isaza, and Uma Lakshminarayan Have you always wanted to build a blog or other web application but haven’t had the time or educational resources to learn? With our blog template, available in our GitHub repo, you can create your web application fast and effortlessly, and even learn to master the new... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Getting Started with Windows Containers
FeedItems.Summary: Containers provide a way of running an application in a controlled environment, isolated from other applications running on the machine, and from the underlying infrastructure. They are a cost-effective way of abstracting away the machine, ensuring that the application runs in the same conditions, from development, to test, to production. Containers started in Linux, as... Read more

FeedItems.Title: ASP.NET Core 2.0 Features
FeedItems.Summary: Last week we announced the release of ASP.NET Core 2.0 and described some top new features, including Razor Pages, new and updated templates, and Application Insights integration. In this blog post we are going to dig into more details of features in 2.0. This list is not exhaustive or in any particular order, but highlights... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Announcing ASP.NET Core 2.0
FeedItems.Summary: The ASP.NET team is proud to announce general availability of ASP.NET Core 2.0.  This release features compatibility with .NET Core 2.0, tooling support in Visual Studio 2017 version 15.3, and the new Razor Pages user-interface design paradigm.  For a full list of updates, you can read the release notes and you can check the list... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Development time IIS support for ASP.NET Core Applications
FeedItems.Summary: With a recent update to Visual Studio 2017, we have added support for debugging ASP.NET Core applications against IIS. This blog post will walk you through enabling this feature and setting up your project to use this feature. Getting Started To get started: You need to install Visual Studio 2017 (version 15.3) Preview (it will... Read more

FeedItems.Title: WCF Web Service Reference Provider – Metadata Exchange Endpoint Authentication
FeedItems.Summary: With the recent update to the WCF Service Reference tool in the VS Marketplace, support has been added for downloading metadata for a web service where the metadata exchange (MEX) endpoint has been secured with IIS authentication. The purpose of MEX endpoints is to allow clients to discover the service capabilities, including security aspects of... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Introducing ASP.NET Core 2.0 Preview 2
FeedItems.Summary: At Build 2017, we released an initial preview version of ASP.NET Core 2.0.  Over the last two months we have incorporated your feedback and added a number of new features.  We now have a Preview 2 version of the ASP.NET Core 2.0 framework and Visual Studio tools for you to try.  In this post, we... Read more

FeedItems.Title: Announcing ASP.NET Core 2.0.0-Preview1 and Updates for .NET Web Developers
FeedItems.Summary: The ASP.NET team is pleased to share the first preview version of the ASP.NET Core 2.0 framework.  In this post, we’ll look at the new features and changes to the web framework that were announced at the Build 2017 keynote and sessions.  We will also look at some other updates that were published for ASP.NET... Read more

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Can't run dnx commands from a solution root" (#981) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Every time I try to run a command from a project using `dnx -p SomeProject some-command` it complains about `project.lock.json` being missing even tho it's present. When I run the command by going to the directory of the project with `dnx some-command` it works.

Here's an example: https://gist.github.com/beraboris/6c1437de9d0ffbbc5355

In this case I have a `global.json` file pointing to the `test/` directory. I also have a test project with xunit called `SomeTest`. This project depends on xunit and its dnx runner. You should notice that I don't have a `test/SomeTest/project.lock.json` file.

I try to run `dnx -p SomeTest test` it complains about `test/SomeTest/project.lock.json` being missing. This is perfectly normal since the file is not there. The error also tells me to run `dnu restore`.

Following the advice from the error, I run `dnu restore` which creates `test/SomeTest/project.lock.json`. This is illustrated in the following command.

I try to run `dnx -p SomeTest test` again and I get the same error. This time it's not expected behaviour because the required file does exist.

I then try to go to the `test/SomeTest` directory and run the test command directly (`dnx test`) and the command runs fine.

I should note that I'm running Arch Linux 64 bit with dnx v1.0.0-beta7, and mono v4.0.3.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "VS 2017 Debugger Hangs on start" (#2235) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I use Visual studio 2017 x64 on Windows 10 x64 with Dot Net core 1.1
My project is using the last 1.1.X dependencies available.

I have a starnge issue with an ASP.Net Core projetct.

Since recently everything worked fine. The dubugger took a while to start but was ok.

Now when I launch the debugger, the webSite is starting fine, but VS Hangs on a message telling the web server took too long time to start.

I tried to make an application console instead of using IIS Express, The debugger is starting nicely.

I have another issue in this case: I'm using custom url to test subdomains rooting, and brakpoints doesn't hit in this case.

So I can't debug anymore.

Finaly I created a fresh project and the debugger worked fine.

I assume there's something in my code that doesn't please to Visual Studio or .Net Core, But I didn't fint out what for now.

Any Idea?

Thanks.

MHoward

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update bootstrappers" (#918) at aspnet/SignalR
Closed issue ""page" variable in Razor breaks in 2.0?" (#6931) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody: I have a `_Pagination.cshtml` view that uses a `page` variable, like this: ``` @model Daniel15.Web.ViewModels.Shared.PaginationModel ... @for (var page = 1; page <= Model.TotalPages; page++) { if (page == Model.CurrentPage) { @page } else { @page } } ``` After upgrading from 1.1 to 2.0, I'm hitting this error: ``` The 'page` directive must appear at the start of the line. + @page The 'page' directives value(s) must be separated by whitespace. + @page The 'page` directive must appear at the start of the line. + @page The 'page' directive may only occur once per document. + @page The 'page' directives value(s) must be separated by whitespace. + @page ``` I guess this is due to Razor pages (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/mvc/razor-pages/) using the `@page` directive (and thus disallowing usage of variables called `page` within Razor), however, shouldn't this be mentioned in the upgrade notes? It's not in the migration docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/migration/1x-to-2x/

It's not in the migration docs: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/aspnet/core/migration/1x-to-2x/

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Update bootstrappers" (#6859) at aspnet/Mvc
Closed issue "RemoteAttribute not creating correct URL when route contains an area and no explicit routes defined" (#6878) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
The `RemoteAttribute.GetUrl()` method is not returning the correct URL when an action lives inside of an area and no explicit route is defined in Startup.cs

You can see this if you only use attribute routing and decorate a view model property with the `RemoteAttribute` and specify values pointing to an Action within an Area.

I attempted to debug using symbols that were available and was able to narrow the issue down to somewhere behind `RouteCollection.GetVirtualPath()` in `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Routing`.

The `GetVirtualPath()` method iterates all `IRouters` (in my case only a single `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.AttributeRoute`) and calls` GetVirtualPath()` using the provided `VirtualPathContext`, which in this case comes from a `UrlHelper` newed up in the `RemoteAttribute.GetUrl()` method.

I've verified that the area name provided to the `RemoteAttribute` constructor is included in the Values property on `VirtualPathContext`.

The call to `AttributeRoute.GetVirtualPath()`  in this scenario is consistently returning `null`.

I was unable to locate any public symbols for `Microsoft.AspNetCore.Mvc.Internal.AttributeRoute` so I could not debug further.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "KeyVault extension should provide an overload that takes KeyVaultClient and doesn't require IIdentityBuilder" (#1456) at aspnet/Identity
Events.RelatedBody:
Required for:
https://github.com/aspnet/specs/issues/90

1. We don't have `TUser, TRole` in light-up so there is no way to call `AddIdentity`.
2. When using MSI (https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/active-directory/msi-overview) we get auth callback for  `KeyVaultClient` instead of ClientSecret/ClientID

/cc @javiercn

Opened issue "[2.0.x] Builds are not reproducible without Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.CoreFxLab.Sources" (#2105) at aspnet/KestrelHttpServer
Events.RelatedBody:
The 2.0.x branch of Kestrel has a package dependency on Microsoft.AspNetCore.Internal.CoreFxLab.Sources, however, there is no open-source way to figure out exactly how to generate this package. 

Recommendations:

Either
 - Add corefxlab as a git submodule
 - Add scripts to kestrel to generate the package
 - Add scripts to aspnet/Universe to generate this package

cc @pakrym @mikeharder

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "IEmailSender should have explicitly named parameters for html vs plain text" (#868) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
There have been a number of people reporting bugs about the email confirmation link in the StarterWeb template not working.

This is happening because people implement IEmailSender and don't realize that the message being passed in is html. When they send the email as plain text the confirmation link does not work because of the url encoding.

I think the "message" parameter of SendEmailAsync should be renamed to htmlMessage and possibly should have an additional parameter for "plainTextMessage" and both should be passed in from AccountController.

This would make it more clear to implementors of IEmailSender what kind of string(s) they are dealing with and how to correctly implement it.

related issues:
https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2152
https://github.com/aspnet/Home/issues/2217

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot update @angular to 4.3.0+ (trying to update to 4.3.6)" (#866) at aspnet/Templates
Events.RelatedBody:
After updating angular to 4.3.6, an internal server error begins to throw "NodeInvocationException: Can't resolve all parameters for HttpXsrfCookieExtractor."

Steps to reproduce:
1. cmd to c:\
2. dotnet --version 
_2.0.0_
3. mkdir dummy
4. cd dummy
5. dotnet new angular
6. dotnet restore
7. npm install
8. dotnet run (prove it works)
8a. ctrl+c to stop the server/build
9. update all @angular from "4.2.5" to "4.3.6"
10. npm update
11. dotnet run
...You should now crash... (see below)
12. change 4.3.6 back to 4.2.5 and 
repeat 10 and 11.
You should now work again.

Please let me know i there's anything else i can provide to help. Thank you!

`NodeInvocationException: Can't resolve all parameters for HttpXsrfCookieExtractor: (?, [object Object], [object Object]).

Please let me know i there's anything else i can provide to help. Thank you!

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "(package.json) Namespaced packages do not display version & details on hover-over" (#829) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody:
(latest) VStudio 2015 Update **3**

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574412/19649471/eadc6be0-99d3-11e6-9d8e-565003f9e2cd.png)

When hovering over Namespaced packages (@whatever/), version numbers and details are labeled as "Uknown".

Also intellisense comes out as "Unknown" as well when typing in the version area to the right.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2574412/19649727/e3f93e56-99d4-11e6-81e8-a89cd21abeee.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Having multiple sites with the same IIS Express launch url causes VS to launch the wrong site" (#431) at aspnet/Tooling
Events.RelatedBody: The Security repo has three sample sites with the same launch url. (It needs to be the same because that url is registered with a remote auth server).  This can cause VS / IIS Express to launch the wrong site.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "WsFederation 2.0.0-preview1 out of band release" (#271) at aspnet/Announcements
Closed issue "Model does not serialize to the camelCase by default" (#270) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: I am returning a data of the IEnumerable type as a Model of View. And I wait for that a Model has will properties with camelCase formatting as when getting a data from WebApi controller.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Model does not serialize to the camelCase by default" (#270) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody: I am returning a data of the IEnumerable type as a Model of View. And I wait for that a Model has will properties with camelCase formatting as when getting a data from WebApi controller.
